1.content:
My name is Ken Maxwell. That's the name on my birth certificate. Nowadays, a lot of people also call me Charlie. I answer to both names. Charlie is a common name for... but I'm getting ahead of myself.

I live with my parents, my younger brother, Joel, and my kid sister, Kristen. For the most part, we get along, although Joel and I do like to tease each other. The more embarrassing it is, the less likely either of us will let the other one live it down.

Dad's a veterinarian. In fact, his clinic is where this little tale begins...

******************************


I was 15 years old at the time. Joel was 12, and Kristen was 5. School had let out for the summer, so I was doing odd jobs for my dad at the clinic.

On this particular day, I had just come in, and Dad was finishing up his examination of a Cocker Spaniel bitch. (That's the word, look it up.) "Can I pet him?" I asked.

"Her," Dad corrected me. "She's perfectly healthy, so I don't see why not."

She liked having me pet her. (All Cocker Spaniels love it when you pet them. Trust me, I know this.) "I don't think I've seen her before. Where'd you get her?"

"A fellow who works at that research lab outside of town brought her in," he answered. "I assume he just got her."

"So, what's next? Give her her shots? Spay her?"

Up until then, this Cocker Spaniel had been the friendliest dog you'd ever expect to see. The second I mentioned spaying her, though, she turned and bit me on the hand.

I cried out. As Dad took a look at my hand, the dog made good her escape. "Wonder what brought that on?" Dad asked.

"It was when I asked about spaying her," I said. "It's like she knew what that was, and didn't like it."

"That hardly seems likely," Dad replied. "Well, at least we know she doesn't have anything, and this bite isn't too bad. I'll wash this out, patch you up, then tell her owner that she ran off. Then we can forget the whole thing."

Well, he washed it out, and he patched me up, and he called the guy. But we didn't forget about it.

Not by a long shot.
1.title: How My Life Went to the Dogs

11.content:
The rest of the day was uneventful. Mom worried about my hand, and Joel found every excuse he could to hit my hand. Other than that, nothing major.

I was getting ready for bed. I was in my pajamas, and I went to turn off the light in the ceiling. That's when it started.

All of a sudden, I could smell everything in my room. And I mean everything. I could even smell where Mom touched my pajamas when she washed them last.

While I was trying to figure that out, my hearing went wild. I could hear Mom reading Kristen a bedtime story down the hall. I could hear Joel playing a game on his tablet, even though Mom had a strict no-electronics-after-8:00 rule.

Then, something happened to my vision. Now, given how my sense of smell and my sense of hearing suddenly went to 11, you'd probably think I got incredible eyesight. I didn't, though. The opposite, in fact: while I could still see blues and yellows, everything green suddenly looked white. Reds, oranges, indigo, violet: these all turned dark gray.

I was still trying to figure this out when everything went screwy. It was like dizziness mixed with a massive shift in perspective. I dropped to all fours, closed my eyes, and hoped that this wouldn't last too long.

It didn't, maybe 15 seconds. But, when I opened my eyes, I was wrapped in fabric that looked somehow strange and familiar at the same time. I wriggled out of it, and saw that it was my pajama top, somehow grown much too big for me. Or had I grown too small?

As I looked around, I began to notice other things that were wrong. Like, there seemed to be something sticking out of my face. I lifted a hand to knock it away, and felt my face. Then I noticed that my hand didn't look right.

My brain began to put it all together: my senses, my size, my shape.

It all spelled one bizarre conclusion: I had become a dog.
11.title: The First Time It Happened

111.content:
Okay, stay calm, I told myself. There has to be a good explanation for this. I mean, there's no possible way it's exactly what it looks like, right?

Convincing myself, I decided to walk around my room. My nose found the whole room interesting. There were so many great smells.

Okay, that's what this is, I thought. Mom's always on me about how much my room smells. I'm just dreaming I'm something that appreciates the odors. Convincing myself that it was just a dream, I could go with the flow and see where this dream went.

Well, apparently, where it went was, I got tired, so I jumped up onto my bed. I couldn't turn off my bedside lamp, so I left that on. I turned around a few times, then curled up and went to sleep.

******************************


The next morning, I woke up, and checked myself out.

Senses normal? Check.

Fingers? Check.

Lack of fur? Check.

"Boy, that was some weird dream," I said aloud. "I even had to look to make sure it wasn't real."

Or was it?

Like, why was my lamp still on, like I didn't turn it off before I fell asleep?

And why did I sleep on top of the sheet?

And why was I naked?

Looking around, I found my pajamas on the floor, precisely where I'd crawled out of them in the "dream." The top was completely buttoned.

And there were hairs inside my pajamas. Dog hairs.

No longer knowing what to think, I put my pajamas back on and went to take a shower.
111.title: I Keep Calm

1111.content:
It was a Saturday, so Dad let one of his associates run the clinic, and we all spent time together. On this particular day, none of us wanted to do anything in particular, so we just sat and watched TV. In retrospect, I was glad things worked out that way. I mean, imagine if what happened happened in a park, or at the movies...

We were sitting on the couch, and I straightened up, alert. "Something smells good," I said.

"I don't know what," Mom replied. "Nobody's cooking."

Nevertheless, I followed the aroma of cooking meat to the window. Smoke told me people a few blocks away were grilling.

And I could smell it. Through glass.

All of a sudden, the TV was blaring. I turned to ask who turned it up so loud, and saw the rest of the family sitting comfortably. Only I thought it was too loud. Just like only I could smell steaks cooking blocks away.

This is awfully familiar...

Just as I thought that, my vision went wonky. "Uh-oh," I said, "that wasn't a dream."

"What wasn't?" Mom asked.

Before I could answer, I dropped to my knees and began to change.

The whole family smelled shocked. Mom screamed. Somebody asked, "What in the world... ?"

Kristen walked right up to me. "Doggy!" She helped me get out of my clothes.

"Mom," Joel asked, "what's going on?"

"I don't know," she replied. "One minute, your brother's standing there; the next, he's a Cocker Spaniel."

That can't be a coincidence, I thought.

Thinking the same thing, Dad got up and picked up the phone. "It's Chris," he said. "Read me the file on that Cocker Spaniel that ran off yesterday."
1111.title: Hanging Out with My Family

choices: I change back on the way.
11111.content:
I was not certain how or why, but I could hear both Dad and a man named David on the other line, talking to each other. "The dog that ran off was an unknown breed of Cocker Spaniel." Serious, David said. "Stranger still, she wasn't a mix, but a purebred."

"What do you mean she was an unknown breed?" Turning pale, Dad demanded.

"Chris, the dog had five independent toenails on the front and back paws, almost looking like fingers and toes." With a hint of excitement, David replied. "Also, her intelligence was off the scale, as Cocker Spaniels go. She had managed to avoid the dog catcher for months before finally getting caught."

Having his phone on blue-tooth, Dad gently picked me up and quickly examined my front and back paws. Sure enough, I had five independent toenails, and I could wiggle them slightly, though I doubted I would ever be able to pick anything up with them. "Anything else you found unusual or exciting, besides her toenails and intelligence?"

"We did not have her long enough to do a full study, but I did find that she seemed to recognize a lot of voice commands, which is unusual for any normal breed of Cocker Spaniel."

Dad frowned. "I want the full report on my desk within the hour." Serious, he said. "I'm on my way in with a patient."

I inwardly winced as a low whimper escaped my lips, hearing the word patient. Dad ended the call, then turned to me. "Sorry, Ken." Softly, he said. "The only way I know to help you at the moment is to give you the vet treatment."

A series of whimpers and yelps came out as I began to cry. Joel stepped up, concerned. "Is Ken going to be okay, Dad?" Worried, he asked.

Dad sighed. "I'll know more after I read the report and run some tests." Serious, he said. "Everyone in the car, we're going to the Pet Clinic."

With that said, Dad handed me to Mom, who carried me to the car, while Joel gathered up my discarded clothes.
11111.title: What the File Said

choices: is a human inside a Cocker Spaniel.
111111.content:
Upon arriving at Pet Clinic, which Dad owned, we met one of his employees, David. He was young, in his twenties, with brown hair and brown eyes, a fresh graduate from Purdue University. "Here is the report you requested, boss." Politely, he said. He smiled at me. "Who do we have here?"

"This is a stray we found while on a picnic." With a straight face, Dad lied. "Kristen has become attached to him, so I'm running him through the numbers." He then whispered, "This stays off the books until we know for certain we have found a new dog breed."

David nodded. "Best not to jump the gun and risk making fools out of ourselves." Serious, he said. "Do you need any help?"

Dad shook his head. "I can handle this, thank you." Politely, he said. "You just enjoy the long weekend and... not a word about these two dogs until we learn more."

David nodded, then left the building. Once he was gone, Dad got to work on me, starting with measuring my weight and checking my heart and lungs. I was not prepared when Dad then pushed a thermometer into my backside, and let out a yelp of surprise. If Mom was not holding me, I would have likely turned around. "His weight is good for a normal Cocker Spaniel, as is his heart, lungs, and temperature." Calmly, Dad said. He sighed. "Moving on,... say ah."

Sighing inside, I opened my mouth, and Dad took a look at my gums and teeth. After a moment of looking into my mouth, Dad turned and began to prep a needle. This startled me and I tried to yell, 'Don't you dare!' Only what came out was Ront Ro Rare!"

Dad paused, turning to me, but smiled as Kristen blurted out, "Scooby Doo!"

"Sorry, Ken." Tossing the needle, he said. "Force of habit."

"What were you going to give him?" Worried, Mom demanded.

"It was a standard vaccination shot." Blushing, Dad explained. "While it would not have killed Ken as a human, it would have left him ill to be certain."

"Why can't Ken talk very well?" Wincing, Joel asked.

"Actually, dogs are very intelligent creatures." Serious, Dad said. "However, the shape of their mouths and tongues make it very difficult to impossible for them to form the complex words of any language, given they had enough intelligence to learn the words."

"Do you think Ken will be able to talk to us?" Wincing, Mom asked.

Dad shook his head. "Even if he were to somehow find a way to talk to us, I would not recommend it." Softly, he said. "The less attention he draws onto himself, the better, until we can get to the bottom of all of this."

With that, I was taken into the X-Ray room, where Dad took a number of pictures of my insides before returning me to Mom, who knelt down to allow Kristen to pet me. I do not know why, but being petted made me feel calmer, and I began to wag my tail in response. "Nice doggie." Smiling, Kristen said. "Can we keep him?"

"He's your brother, not a pet." Firmly but kindly, Mom corrected.

Moments later, Dad returned with a worried expression on his face. Noticing this, Mom rose to her feet. "What did you find?" Softly, she demanded.

Dad sighed. "All of the tests point towards Ken... "
111111.title: The vet treatment.

1111111.content:
Dad sighed. "All of the tests point towards Ken being mostly a normal Cocker Spaniel." Serious, he said. "There are several abnormalities that have me worried."

"What do you mean?" Worried, Mom asked.

Dad motioned to me. "First, Cocker Spaniels normally all have dark round eyes with almond shaped rims." Calmly, he explained. "Ken has almost human-like eyes that are a bright blue. On top of that, his vision is superb for a dog. Second, his muscle mass is greater than any normal Cocker Spaniel I have ever treated... he has the strength of a Bulldog pup. What's more, he's just a puppy, which means he will likely get bigger and stronger."

Mom and Joel were stunned while Kristen seemed confused. "So, Ken is a strong puppy?"

Dad gave a patient smile. "Yes, in this form, Ken is a strong puppy."

"What else did you find?" Softly, Mom demanded.

"Ken's individual digits on all four of his paws do not give him the ability to pick anything up, but they do give him the ability to run much faster than any normal breed of Cocker Spaniel." Serious, dad said. "In fact, he likely could give dogs twice his size a good run for their money. Plus, the X-rays showed that his bones and claws are more dense than normal breeds. Ken can likely do some damage with his claws if he wanted to." He sighed, shaking his head. "An unknown breed, indeed...."

"What?" Worried, Joel asked.

"Ken is not your usual Cocker Spaniel." Serious, Dad explained. "He is stronger and faster, with superior senses, as well as claws that can be used in defense." He turned to me. "I trimmed them down as a precaution."

"You didn't hurt him, did you?" Worried, Kristen asked.

Dad smiled. "No, pumpkin." Kindly, he said. "Everyone needs to have their nails trimmed here and there."

I whimpered as my senses began to quickly dull. It almost felt as if I was about to pass out. Everyone turned to me just as I changed back almost instantaneously. I was now human again, lying naked on the examination table. Mom and Dad sighed as Joel turned away, turning Kristen around with him, who was pouting. "I wanted a dog..."

"Um,... can I have my clothes, please?" Blushing, I asked.

Mom pulled my clothes out of a backpack and handed them to me, before ushering the others out so I could change. Within minutes, I was dressed, and was being taken to the car. "What are we going to do, dear?" Wincing, Mom asked.

Dad sighed. "Until we sort all of this out, we are going to have to buy everything needed to raise a Cocker Spaniel pup." Somewhat sadly, he replied. "We do not want this to get out that our son has become some form of Lycan."

"Some form of Lycan..." Sighing, I thought. Who would have thought that this werewolf becomes a Cocker Spaniel...
1111111.title: Unknown breed.

11111111.content:
I was not comfortable having to wait alone in the car while the rest of the family walked around in the pet store to buy things. Especially not when they were items to be used on me when I become a Cocker Spaniel. Still, because I was becoming a dog at seemingly random times, it was for the best that I stay put.

"It's not fair..." Pouting, I muttered. "Why me..."

Then I caught some movement and turned to find the female Cocker Spaniel from before that had bit me on the hand. She looked directly at me for a moment, then hurried off through some bushes and was gone. i was tempted to run after her, but the fear of changing out in the open with no way to identify me held me back. "Was she checking in on me?" Curious, I wondered.

My family returned a few minutes later, with a large assortment of dog items in brown paper bags. "We will go over everything, including a few new house rules for you, when we get home." Serious, Dad said. "Just try to understand that none of them are personal."

I pouted at that, getting the feeling that I was about to lose a lot of my freedoms. "I- I saw that other Cocker Spaniel. I think she was sort of checking in on me."

"If that's the case, we may see her again." Calmly, Mom said. "For now, we need to get the house ready for a... pet."

"I'm still your son..." Tearing up, I protested.

Mom sighed. "Yes, you are." Patiently, she said. "Only it would be difficult to tell people a Cocker spaniel is our child, so, while you are in that form, you will be a pet."

"It's not personal, Ken." Serious, Dad repeated. "We are trying to avoid a darker fate."

"A... darker fate?" Gulping, I asked.

Mom nodded. "Suppose word got out that you are some form of Lycan." softly, she said. "There will be scientists and government agencies wanting to know how it happened..."

"I'd be a lab rat." crying, I said.

Dad nodded. "It is better to be our pet occasionally, than a guinea pig for the rest of your life."

I was crying at that point as we all drove home. There, Dad unloaded the pet products, which included all natural brand of dog food and dog treats (I wondered how soon before I would find out how those tasted), metal dog dishes, a large litter box with a big bag of kitty litter, and a long, strong leather leash with a collar.

"The metal bowls are more hygienic than plastic, and I know from experience that Cocker Spaniels can be litter box trained." Calmly, Dad said. "This will prevent any accidents involving you changing back after going out to do your business."

"The collar and leash are because Cocker Spaniels are hunting dogs by nature. They need exercise, or they will become restless." Calmly, Mom added. "That means walks."

"But... if I change back,... " Worried, I said.

"It is a risk, I agree." Serious, Dad said. "However, it's not fair to just lock you up in the house while you are in dog form."

"Now for the new house rules." Serious, Mom said. "You are not to go anywhere alone outside of the house, for any reason. No one is to tell anyone of Ken's condition, period."

"As a dog, you will be named Charlie." Calmly, Dad added. "You will wear the collar and leash at all times while outside, and, the next time you change..." He sighed, wincing. "You will need a dog license, and you will need to be chipped."

My eyes went wide, hearing that. "Chipped...?"

"I'm afraid it's the law, sweetie." Wincing, Mom said.

"It's relatively painless." Sighing, Dad said. "Also, it is nothing more than a way to identify a lost dog and link it to its owner."

"What about my friend, Josh, and my girlfriend, Madison?" Worried, I asked. "They're bound to find out sooner or later."

"We will cross that bridge when we get to it." patiently, Mom said. "For now, your litter box and food dishes will be in the unused breakfast nook off of the kitchen."

With that said, Dad set up the litter box in a corner of the breakfast nook and set the food dishes on the other side of the unused area. The dog food did not smell too bad as I watched him pour it into one of the bowls, but the thought of eating it was a bit of a turn off. "This dog food is made of real meats and vegetables." Calmly, Dad said. "Only it's balanced for a dog rather than a human, so I do not recommend trying it, unless you are Charlie."

After dinner, I went to bed feeling a bit depressed, and fell into a restless sleep.
11111111.title: At the pet store.

111111112.content:
I woke up the following morning to the smell of bacon, eggs, and toast. It made my mouth water as I opened my eyes, only to wish I had kept them shut. I was surrounded my my own pajamas, which meant only one thing: I was a Cocker Spaniel once again. Growling out my frustration, I struggled out from my pajamas and sheets before jumping down onto the floor, just as Mom called out, "Kids, breakfast is ready!"

I barked and scratched at my bedroom door, until Kristen opened it and gave a joyous squeal. "Puppy!" She then began to pet me, which caused my tail to wag, as it did feel good. Only I was more interested in getting something to eat, so I darted past her and bound down the stairs, where I was met by Mom. She sighed seeing me, then ruefully pointed to the dog dishes, which were filled with the dog food and cool water.

"Sorry,... Charlie." Calmly, she said. "It has to be this way. Maybe Ken will be around for lunch."

Sighing, I let out a low whimper and walked over to the dog food. To my surprise, it smelled great and tasted better. It was like having bacon, steak, eggs, and greens, all in one bowl. After licking my chops from my morning meal, I drank some water and turned to the litter box. "I guess now I have to learn how to use a litter toilet." Sadly, I thought.

I stepped up into the litter box but paused as I spotted Kristen and Joel, watching me with a sense of bemusement. It was annoying to some degree... who likes being stared at while on the toilet? "Rwat?" Irritated, I demanded.

"Into the dining room, both of you!" Sternly, mom snapped. "No one likes to be stared at." She then sighed and said, without turning, "We'll see if we can put up a privacy curtain for you."

Sighing, I did my business in the kitty litter then buried it with my paw. After I was done, I felt the need to wash my paws. Fortunately, Mom had dropped a damp cloth onto the floor, so I used that. Unfortunately, Mom saw me and threw me a cross look. "Dogs lick their paws to clean them." Calmly, she said. "We can't have you looking too intelligent."

I winced inside. Ew...

"We should have called him Scooby." I heard Kristen say. "He talks like him..."

"Ro Bwother." Rolling my eyes, I said.

A whimper escaped my lips as I felt Mom gently grab my muzzle, holding my mouth closed. "No talking while in dog form, Charlie." Sternly, she warned. "We are trying to keep people from getting too curious about you." She then released my muzzle and held up the collar and leash. "It's time to get your license and chip."

I whimpered at that, as I did not like the thought of having a chip in me as Ken. Still, I had no choice or say in the matter, as Dad carried me to the car...
111111112.title: I woke up as Charlie.

1111111122.content:
I had changed back into Ken about halfway home, and was still pouting as dad carried me back into the house, wrapped in a blanket to hide my nudity. "The vaccinations should not harm you in human form." Patiently, Dad said. "And no one will notice the chip, unless you tell them."

I hurried up the stairs, still blushing, still wearing the collar and leash, the second dad put me down inside the house. I felt violated and betrayed, though part of me knew and understood it had to be done. Upon getting dressed and ripping off the collar, I felt the back of my neck... the chip was there, halfway between my shoulders and head on the left side. I had always known that a dog had a rough life, but I never expected to be living the life of one. A sigh escaped my lips as I looked at myself in the mirror. "Why me... ?"

A knock at my bedroom door startled me. "Who's there?" My voice quivering, I demanded.

The door opened and Mom walked in. "Do you feel like talking?" Softly, she asked.

"I feel like screaming and throwing things." Pouting, I replied. "I have rights, you know!"

Mom sighed. "Yes, you have rights,... both as Ken and Charlie." Calmly, she said. "Only we also have laws that ensure the safety of both personas, and those around them."

"What do you mean?" Taken aback, I demanded.

"Ken,... Cocker Spaniels rarely live over fifteen years." Softly, Mom said. "We want to ensure that part of you makes it at least that far."

I immediately began to tear up. "Only fifteen years?"

Mom nodded. "If you are very lucky." Almost whispering, she said. "Stress does not help those odds, Ken. We are doing all we can to help you,... try to understand that."

My lips quivered. "It doesn't make it any easier, Mom." Softly, I said. "I'm not mad at Dad, or anyone else...." I began to cry. "I'm scared..."

Mom pulled me into a hug as I cried onto her shoulder. She looked up at the door to find Dad standing there, with a pained look on his face. "We need to find that other dog." Whispering, Mom said. "she has the clues we need."

Dad slowly nodded. "I know..." Sadly, he replied. "Only you are talking about finding a needle in a haystack... it will not be easy."
1111111122.title: I return home as Ken.

choices: I change back while on the walk.
11111111222.content:
Lunch time came around, and I was, thankfully, still me. I was enjoying a ham and cheese sandwich when a knock came to the door. It was my best friend, Josh, and my girlfriend, Madison. Mom let them in, and they put their book bags down joined at the dinning room table. "You two hungry?" Smiling, Mom asked.

"Josh is always hungry, Mrs. Maxwell." Grinning, Madison replied. "I'll just have a quick sandwich before hitting the mall. We're taking our book bags along to carry our purchases." She turned to me. "Care to come with?"

I winced at that, causing Madison to sigh. "What did you do...?"

"Ken is in quarantine." Serious, Dad replied. "He was bitten by a female dog the other day, and it's having some... ill effects on him."

Madison looked at me with pity. "Is it bad or contagious?"

"Are you going to turn into a werewolf?" Grinning, Josh asked.

Knowing Josh's sense of humor, I chuckled at that. "Let's just say Mom and Dad are keeping me on a short leash for now." Ruefully, I said. "I hope its not contagious, but I don't plan on biting anyone anytime soon."

"He is not to leave the house alone, as his... condition causes certain behavioral changes." Calmly, Dad explained. "Also, we need to carry a change of clothes for him, just in case."

"It sounds like a major case of rabies." Wincing, Madison said. "Has he seen the doctor?"

"Ken has had all of his needed shots, so he should be fine." Serious, Dad said. "Only it's not rabies,... it's something more complex than that."

Just as Dad said that, I felt it happening again, and immediately blushed profusely. Josh and Madison noticed right away, and watched in a mixture of horror and fascination as I almost instantly became a Cocker Spaniel right before their eyes.

"Dude!" Shocked, Josh yelled. "You are a werewolf!"

Madison knelt down as I struggled out of my clothes and jumped off the chair to the floor. "Ken, is that really you...?"

I nodded my head, to which Madison looked at me wide-eyed before petting me. I wagged my tail, as it felt good, especially coming from her. I was a bit disappointed when she stopped and turned to my parents. "How did this happen?!"

"We're not sure." Sadly, Mom replied. "Until we can find the dog that bit him, all we can do is try to keep him as comfortable as we can, in either form. By the way, while in dog form, his name is Charlie."

"We need to keep a tight lid on this." Serious, Dad said. "We don't want our son to become some lab rat to some scientist somewhere."

"Is there any way we can help?" Worried, Josh asked.

"Maybe I can take him for a walk." After a thought, Madison said. "Perhaps the fresh air will help him relax."

"Go ahead." Sighing, Mom said. "Just be certain to take a change of clothes for him, in case he changes back."

With that, she handed Madison my leash and collar, which she put on me. She then grabbed a book bag by the door, before leading me out.
11111111222.title: lunch as Ken.

choices: We are caught as I was getting dressed.
111111112221.content:
The walk was rather pleasant, to be honest, as I was experiencing sights, sounds, and smells I would have never picked up as Ken. It was even better, as I was spending some quality time with Madison, though I would rather have been doing it as her boyfriend. We had walked about a block and a half from the house to the public swimming pool when I felt the sensation of me changing back again. I pawed at Madison, whimpering until i got her attention, and pawed at the book bag.

"Now...?" surprised, Madison asked.

I nodded, whimpering again, to which Madison knotted her jaws and quickly led me to the public pool and rushed me into the boy's restroom. Fortunately, there was no one there at the time, due to a sign that read: Temporarily closed for regular maintenance. I had just made it into one of the stalls when I changed back. "Quick!" Blushing, I whispered. "Give me my clothes!"

Madison opened the book bag then gulped, blushing herself. "I must have grabbed my own book bag out of habit." Wincing, she said.

"What...?!" Blushing more, I demanded.

"Now, now, don't panic." Quickly, Madison said. "I'll run back to your house and get the right book bag. It should only take me a few minutes. Just sit tight in there, and I'll be back as soon as I can with your clothes."

With that, she ran off, leaving me alone and naked in the boy's bathroom stall. "Please hurry..."

I had only been waiting in the stall for about a minute when I heard small footsteps entering the restroom, coming towards the stall I was hiding. My heart skipped a beat as I saw a small shadow appear before the Cocker Spaniel that had bit me days before peered in at me! As she walked in under the door, I saw that she was wearing a long tube dress. She looked up at me, with her tail wagging in a way I somehow recognized as bemusement, before she instantly changed before my eyes! I immediately blushed profusely, as there was now an attractive teenage girl standing in the stall with me! She was wearing the same tube dress as before, but stretched out almost to the point of being skin tight...

"Get over yourself, lover boy." Flatly, she said. "My name is Kira. In dog form, I take the name of Fluffy. And yes, I heard all the jokes..."

"We don't have a lot of time to bullshit, Kira!" Sternly, a deep male voice scolded. "Open the stall door so we can get this over with!"

Sighing, Kira opened the door, revealing a short but muscular boy I had never seen before, in a bodysuit. He tossed me a clean pair of boxer swim trunks, which I quickly put on for dignity's sake. "You have been watching over me all this time, haven't you?" Softly, I demanded.

"Look, I feel sorry for you, as my bite was of bad timing." Sternly, Kira said. "Still, you need to learn to control your transformations, before they control you."

"Are you going to teach me?" Wincing, I asked.

"I'm not sure I can trust you or your family." Frowning, Kira replied. "You try being kidnapped, locked in a tiny cage, called a bitch, and threatened with forced surgery..."

I did not know what to say at that point, so all that came out was, "Sorry..."

"Enough!" Firmly, the boy barked. "I am Butch, top dog, if you will. I need you to pay close attention, your life will depend upon it."

I gulped. "I'm listening...."

"We are Lycans." Firmly, Butch explained. "Nothing like the werewolves of horror stories you may have heard, just a people who can change into different forms of dogs."

"Our bite carries a certain poison that transforms humans into Lycans like us, but only for twenty four hours after a full moon." Serious, Kira added. "It is how we procreate, thus my bite was of poor timing."

"As well as poor judgement." Frowning, Butch said. "Thus, Kira's punishment is to keep an eye on you, until we can determine if your transformations have become stable."

"How can you tell if it has become stable?" Worried, I asked. "What happens if it does?"

"If your transformations continue after the next full moon, we will know it has become stable, thus permanent." Serious, Butch said. "Once that happens, you will either become a Cocker Spaniel for life or a Lycan like us."

"If that happens, we will welcome you among us." Softly, Kira said.

"You mean I won't see my family again...?" Worried, I asked.

"You can stay with your family, if you so wish." Calmly, Butch said. "However, with us, you will be family all the time, rather than a 'pet' part of the time. Think about it..."

With that said, he instantly transformed into a large bulldog, which gave a heavy bark before running off, with Kira becoming a Cocker Spaniel again and following. Less than a minute later, Madison returned, out of breath, with the right book bag with my clothes. "Sorry it took me so long, Ken." Between breaths, she said. "I went as fast as I could." She paused, seeing me. "Where did you get those swim trunks... and why are you shaking?"

I was shaking; badly, in fact. "I met the other Cocker Spaniel." Trembling, I said. "You are not going to believe this..."
111111112221.title: The Lycan.

choices: I learn of a new change trigger.
1111111122211.content:
Upon arriving home, I told my family and friends of my encounter with Kira and Butch, who had referred to themselves as the Lycan. Dad listened with intense interest, while Mom winced here and there. Joel and Kristen were wide eyed hearing my tale, as were Josh and Madison. When I had finished, Dad began to drum his fingers onto the table. "This is worrisome." Serious, he said. "There had been reports of the stray dog population exploding in recent years. What you said gives a dark clue as to why."

"You think these Lycan are trying to build up their numbers?" Worried, Mom asked. "Why...?"

"The same reason any race would want to build their numbers." Serious, Dad replied. "So they don't go extinct." He sighed. "I need to talk to this Butch."

"I never saw him before today." Serious, I reminded. "How are you going to reach him?"

"You said that Kira was to keep an eye on you, right?" Calmly, Dad asked.

I nodded.

"Then we will simply leave a note low on the door for her to find, and arrange a meeting."

"How do you intend to pull that off?" Shrugging, Josh asked. "From what Ken said, they don't carry much trust in us."

"I am the leading veterinarian in this region." Serious, Dad explained. "If I tell them I want to learn the difference between a Lycan and a regular dog, to avoid another incident like with Ken, they may agree to a meeting."

"It's worth a try." Sighing, Mom said. "Maybe they know of a way to reverse it."

"We can only hope." Sighing as well, Dad agreed.
1111111122211.title: At home.

11111111222111.content:
Dad got to work on the letter. It was brief and to the point...

Lycan...

My son is a victim, just as Kira was. As your people are unknown to human record, we need to meet so as to avoid any further incidents involving such misunderstandings. I am the leading veterinarian in this region, it is for both our benefit that we come to an understanding.

Dr. Maxwell.

Dad sealed the note in an envelope then taped it to the bottom half of the door, with the word 'Butch' in large bold letters on the front. After that, it was only a matter of waiting.

"Do you think they will agree to talk to you?" Worried, I asked.

"It is in their best interests that they do." Calmly, Dad replied. "Also, it's our one chance to see if there is any cure for you."

An hour later, I was back to being Charlie, and smelled Butch approaching. I trotted to the front door just as I heard a loud bark, and barked back. Dad opened the door just in time to see a large bulldog run off. There was a note lying on the ground on the doorstep...

Dr. Maxwell,

We will meet with you, but on our terms. The abandoned junkyard just outside of the suburban area is where we call home. You and I will talk there tomorrow, at dawn. Do not make me regret taking this risk.

Butch.

"It seems they have agreed to a meeting at the old junkyard." Serious, Dad said.

"You aren't going there alone, are you?" Worried, Mom asked.

"I used to play there as a kid." Calmly, Dad replied. "I know a few fast ways out of there, if it comes to that. Still, I think I had better bring Ken or Charlie with me."

"I'm going too." Firmly, Madison said. "He's my.... boyfriend."

If I could, I would have blushed brightly at that. Instead, I wagged my tail. Dad sighed. "You stay in the car where it is safe." Sternly, he ordered. "This meeting could turn sour fast."
11111111222111.title: Dad writes the letter.

111111112221111.content:
The old junkyard was an ominous place, even at dawn. There were a lot of dark places a dog could hide in wait. Dad and I stepped out of the car, leaving Madison in the back seat, to be greeted by dogs: two Russian Huskies, the large Bulldog, and the Cocker Spaniel. I was in human form at the time, feeling more than a bit unnerved. I counted at least thirty eyes staring at us from the many shadows around the piles of cars and car parts surrounding us.

"We are here, as agreed." Calmly, Dad said. "I'd rather keep this civil, if possible."

In an instant, the Bulldog and Cocker Spaniel transformed into humans, while the two huskies remained in dog form. "I am the village leader." Serious, Butch said. "Your letter said you wanted a better understanding between us."

"It would help to know if I am treating a regular dog or a Lycan." Serious, Dad countered. "When Kira found her way into my clinic, I thought I was dealing with nothing more than a regular stray, and now I have a son with an uncertain future."

Kira winced at that, but Butch remained unfazed, neutral. "You understand that I cannot allow you to tell anyone of our existence." Calmly, he said. "If word were to get out, none of us will ever lead a normal life again."

"My son is part of your secret." Equally calm, Dad replied. "My word is my bond."

Butch turned to the two Huskies, who gave a nod. "This is Samson to my right and Hercules to my left." Serious, he said. "Their human names will remain private for now. They are among the few who live within your community in human form. They confirmed your words."

"I talk to all of my patients, as Kira should be able to confirm." Dad said. "I will ask each patient a simple question. It will be their response that will tell me if I am treating a Lycan or a regular dog."

Butch nodded. "Agreed. Who is the girl?"

"My... girlfriend, Madison." Softly, I replied. "She has it in her head to become a Lycan..."

"No one asks to become a Lycan." Serious, Butch said. "There is still no guarantee you will become one, the next full moon will tell the tale." He sighed. "The odds will be the same for your girlfriend unless you find yourself a Lycan and... become one."

I blushed at that, knowing what Butch was telling me. Dad nodded. "The poison is the most effective during the passion of intercourse."

"Correct." Blushing, Kira said. "Other than that, it's a coin toss."

"There is no cure that we know of." Serious, Butch added. "Many of us have tried."

"I'll be sure to tell her." Blushing, I said.

Kira seemed slightly disappointed that I had a girlfriend, but Butch spoke up before the moment became too awkward. "Did you bring your tools of your trade?"

"I carry my tools everywhere I go." Honestly, Dad replied. "You never know when you might find an animal in distress."

Butch sighed. "In that case, I have a few patients for you..."

He gave a low but loud whistle. A moment later, a number of dogs of all breeds slowly, reluctantly came out of hiding. A lot of them were injured, and some of them seemed slightly malnourished, which brought tears to Dad's eye. He truly cared for animals. "I'll get my bag." he turned to me. "Get Madison, I am going to need two assistants..."
111111112221111.title: The meeting.

1111111122211111.content:
One by one, Dad treated all of the injured and fed the malnourished. Most of them were minor injuries, but a few had broken bones, and one was badly torn up. Dad treated him first, with Madison and me helping. "What on Earth ran into you, little one?" Tearfully, Dad asked.

"He was beaten up in dog form by a group of bullies." Frowning, Butch replied. "Rest assured, those bullies heard from us that night."

"The mauling I saw on the news." Frowning back, Dad said.

Butch shook his head. "That was another tribe." To my surprise, he said. "Samson and Hercules dealt with the bullies using video of their actions as evidence. The four teenagers will be spending the rest of their summer vacation in juvenile hall for cruelty to animals."

The small pup cried and whimpered as Dad treated his broken bones and scarred ears. I began to cry with him. *You are in good hands, kid.* Sadly, I thought. *Dad is the best animal doctor around.*

The small Golden Retriever looked up at me, surprised, and I heard his thoughts in my head. *You can talk to me as a human?!*

I was surprised myself. *I- I guess I can...*

*I'm Toby in human form.* Softly, the dog thought to me. *In dog form, I'm Rocky.*

Rocky gave out a happy bark, then licked Dad's face, causing him to chuckle. "You are welcome, little one." Smiling, he said. He turned to Butch. "He will need to rest for the next few days, to allow his bones to heal properly."

Butch nodded. "We will see to it." Calmly, he said.

As Rocky was taken away, the next patient was brought to him, and I talked to each one, helping to keep them all calm while Dad tended to them, with Madison handing him the tools he asked for. Fortunately, it was my job to hold each dog still, so I was able to keep my ability to talk to them a secret... for the moment. It was frightening and exciting at the same time. I had heard of comic book heroes who could talk to animals, but I never thought I would ever be able to do it myself. Still, I did not know how Dad, or anyone else, would react to the news that I could talk to dogs.

"That's the last patient." sighing, Dad said. "If any of them need to see me, just..."

*Don't forget about me!* Limping forward, a small dog called.

"I think we missed one, dad." Blurting out, I said. I pointed to the Chihuahua limping towards us before picking him up. *We will take care of you.* Calmly, I thought to him.

Like the others, the Chihuahua looked at me, surprised, then gave a happy bark as I handed him over to dad to be treated. "As I said, if any of you need extra help, I will leave you my personal number."

Butch nodded. "We are grateful." Calmly, he said.

"You can pay me back by helping my son adapt." Surprising me, Dad said.

Again Butch nodded. "He can sleep here tonight." Calmly, he said. "We will teach him what it means to be a Lycan."

The two shook hands before Dad turned to me. "They can teach you more than I could." Softly, he said. "I'll pick you up in the morning."

I did not know how to react, but I was curious about my new ability to talk to dogs, so I reluctantly agreed with Dad taking a reluctant Madison back home.
1111111122211111.title: Treating the Lycan.

11111111222111111.content:
As I watched Dad drive out of the junkyard into the sunset, I felt the sensation of changing, and became Charlie once more. Butch returned to his dog form, and I was able to understand his barks and whines. "The Lycan do not actually live in the junkyard, it is where we meet." Serious, he said. "We all live in homes of our own."

"You still don't trust my dad." Sadly, I said.

"Not fully, no." Calmly, Butch said. "However, you are definitely a Lycan."

"Because I can talk to dogs in human form..." Sighing, I said.

Butch nodded then turned to Kira. "Fluffy will take you on a tour of the town." Bemused, he said. "She will show you how we Lycan live."

Kira, Fluffy in dog form, sighed. "Let's go..." Huffing, she said.

Curious, I followed Kira out of the junkyard and onto the streets of the town. "Where are we going first?" Uncertain, I asked.

"The Johnson's house." Calmly, Kira replied. "They live the closest to the junkyard, and they have a soft spot for... Fluffy." She gave a face, saying that.

"I take it you do not like the name." Making a face, I said.

"We do not choose our canine names." Flatly, Kira said. "Just as you did no choose your own, they are given to us by the humans we encounter."

Minutes later, we had reached the Johnson's house, where Kira scratched at the door and began to bark and whine, "I'm here... hello..."

Presently, the porch light came on, and the door opened to reveal Mrs Jane Johnson, who smiled kindly down at Kira and me. "Fluffy!" Beaming, she said. "Where have you been hiding?" She then took notice of me and giggled. "I see you have a new suitor, hoping to win your favor."

I blushed at that, though I doubted Mrs Johnson would notice. Before I knew what was happening, I found myself being picked up and carried inside, with Kira following. I was placed onto a soft blanket, while Kira walked up and laid down beside me. "As a dog, you will be manhandled more than you would like. But, if you want to be fed, you have to tolerate it."

Soon after, two dishes of dog food were offered to us. I sniffed it and found the smell terrific. Without thinking, I began to eat, with Kira joining me. After I had finished the bowl, I drank my fill of cool water before asking, *Are we staying here all night?*

Kira shook her head. *This is just my normal patrol of the town. We are here to check up on Daisy, see how she is doing.*

*Daisy?* Confused, I asked.

Kira nodded. *She is a dry Lycan, stuck in dog form, a toy poodle.* Serious, she explained. *Still, she hears things that are useful to our tribe. In return, we watch over her, protect her.*

Soon after, a white toy poodle trotted up to us, wagging her tail. She barked and whined to us and, again, I was surprised, I could understand it. *Kira, glad to see you again.* Happily, she said. *The mayor is planning a capture and release program for stray dogs and cats.*

*Keep us posted on that.* Serious, Kira said. *You will find your usual payment in the back yard in the usual place.*

Daisy nodded then trotted off, while Kira walked towards the doggie door. *Let's go...*

I followed Kira out of the house then asked, *Can Lycan talk to normal dogs?*

*We can, but they do not understand human language.* Serious, Kira replied. *The most they can offer is where to find food, or to provide a distraction for a quick escape when needed.*

"I gulped at that. *I was able to talk to dogs in human form...*

Kira turned to me, surprised. *Butch has that ability too.* Softly, she said. *It's a rare trait among Lycans. I'd keep that talent to yourself, unless you want to end up in a lab somewhere.*

Fearful, I nodded, and Kira led me to our next stop...
11111111222111111.title: A night with the Lycan.

111111112221111112.content:
The next stop was several streets down at the end of a dark road. Upon seeing where we had stopped, I momentarily panicked. *Why are we at the dog pound?!* Startled, I demanded.

Kira hushed me silent with a low growl. *Keep your bark down.* Sternly, she said. *We are here to see Dodger.*

*Who is Dodger?* Curious, I whispered.

*He's our inside eyes and ears of the dog pound.* Serious, Kira replied. *During the day, he cleans the kennels and feeds the dogs. At night, he gets information from them.*

*I thought dogs don't understand human language.* Curious, I said.

*They don't, but they remember the actions of humans, and Dodger can read their minds, thus gaining what they had experienced.* Calmly, Kira explained. *You see, this pound offers a foster care program for the dogs, to further help them get adopted.*

*So, by seeing their experiences,...* Confused, you said.

*We get an overall understanding of who to and not to approach in dog form.* Serious, Kira said. *There are some very cruel people in this town.*

I gulped at that, and Kira led us to a crate near the back door before hitting a button on the fence hidden behind it with her paw. A bell was heard on the inside and the door opened before a lean Basset Hound appeared in the doorway. *You're running a little late, Kira* Scolding, he said.

*So glad to know you care,... Houdini.* Sarcastic, Kira said. *I'm showing a new Lycan the ropes, in case he decides to join the tribe. He has the canine name of Charlie.*

*Ah, the kid you bit a while ago.* Eying me, Dodger said. *Well, fortunately, we have no new Lycans in the kennels, but there are a few new strays with a new brand of horror stories.*

*What news do they bring?* Sighing, Kira asked.

Dodger was silent for a moment before replying, *Sport dog fights.* He sighed. *Both are scheduled for termination.*

*But... they're victims...* Sadly, I said.

*They have been made too aggressive to be deemed safe to adopt.* Also sad, Dodger countered. *That is the sad truth of the matter.*

After a thought, I said, *Let me talk to them. Maybe I can turn them around.*

Dodger shook his head. *Sorry, kid, but they'll tear a little pup like you apart, human or dog.*
111111112221111112.title: The dog pound.

1111111122211111122.content:
Dodger opened a door further into the pound and I heard the two dogs barking angrily and aggressively. I could hear them throwing themselves at the walls and the bars, in an attempt to get out and fight anyone or anything. My ears dropped and my tail slowly moved down between my legs... I was terrified. Seeing me, Dodger sighed, shaking his head sadly. *You have a good heart, Charlie.* Calmly, he said. *However, no one can save them all.* He gave a reassuring whimper. *They will be put down humanely, I can promise you that.*

Albeit reluctantly, I followed Kira away from the pound down the street to a small restaurant near the edge of town. At this point, I was surprised that I had not changed back into my human form. Noting my concern, Kira nudged her nose against mine in some form of reassurance. *The transformations will get longer and longer as you get closer to your first full moon.* Calmly, she explained. *So far, you are not showing any real signs of becoming a dog permanently, but it's still too early to be certain.*

With that, Kira led me to the back of the restaurant where she gave out low barks and yelps before nudging me with her paw. Getting the hint, I began to give out low barks and whines as well until a tall and plump man appeared at the back door. He smiled kindly upon seeing us. "A-hey, Fluffy!" In a heavy Italian accent, he said. "I see you found another boyfriend." He chuckled as I saw the hint of a blush on Kira's face. "You know, you are going to have to settle down sooner or later."

I blushed at that, though the man could not see it, and turned to Kira, who gave a frustrated sigh. *Why do the humans always assume I'm looking for a lover?*

*The same reason they think this with human couples, I guess.* Softly, I replied.

Kira gave a light scoff, then wagged her tail as the man returned with a plate full of scraps. "A-dig in, you two." smiling, he said. "Luigi will bring you a nice bowl of fresh water to wash it down."

After he had left, Kira have a low yelp which summoned a number of strays who quickly grabbed one scrap and ran off with it. Within seconds, there were only two scraps left, which Kira began to nibble on, with me following suit. Shortly after, Luigi returned with the water and gave us each a pet before walking back in.

*What was that all about?* After we had left, I asked.

*Not everyone in our tribe has a home.* Sadly, Kira replied. *Those scraps are all they sometimes get in a day.* She gave a sad whimper. *We watch out for each other, so no one starves.*

*Maybe my dad can help.* Feeling sad, I offered. *He is well known in this city, people listen to him*

*I hope so, Charlie.* Serious, Kira said. *People tend to forget the homeless, human and dog alike...*
1111111122211111122.title: Kira and I move on.

choices: The police come to the property.
11111111222111111221.content:
Kira led me down a dark, rundown street, to a small park, where I was greeted by a sight that would have torn the heartstrings of the bravest of people. Men, women, and children, entire families, huddled around barrels holding campfires. They were living in makeshift huts made of scrap metal, cardboard, anything they could rummage from the trash or along the roads of the city.

*This is one of several parks where the homeless gather at night to try to sleep.* Sadly, Kira explained. *The homeless shelters were closed by the newly elected mayor, Johnson, to save money, while he got a fat raise in salary.*

I growled slightly at that. *Here I thought he was a good guy...*

*There is always a part of someone they do not show the general public.* Darkly, Kira replied. *The mayor stepped on a lot of people to get where he is right now.*

*It's going to be a cold night.* Wincing, I said.

*They have endured nights far colder than this, Charlie.* Flatly, Kira said. *That is the unfortunate life of the forgotten...*

I turned from one side of the small park to the other, seeing little girls and boys crying under the shirt of a man, with his bare back facing the elements. it was enough to make me cry for them, until an idea hit me, and I knotted my jaws in decision.

*Can you get them to follow you?* Suddenly, I asked. *I know of a place, and my family owns it, so they can't be kicked out.*

Kira turned to me, surprised, then turned to the entrance of the park, seeing a number of police officers arrive. "Okay, citizens, you know the law... no loitering on city property... move along."

I could hear children begin to cry harder, and I was tempted to bark in protest, but Kira turned to me sharply. *You better know what you are doing...*

With that, she barked at the leader of the homeless group, then ran off a short distance, then barked again. Getting the idea, I did the same, moving towards a place I knew that was safe. Albeit reluctantly, the man motioned the others to follow. I led Kira and the homeless to a complex of low buildings surrounded by a high fence. As luck would have it, I felt a familiar sensation, and changed back into my human form just as we reached the fence. Fortunately, I had listened to Kira's advice and had worn a jumpsuit. The leader of the homeless group, a tall man with matted black hair and green eyes, paused upon seeing me unlock and open the gates. "Who are you...?" Firmly, he demanded.

"Um... My name is Ken Maxwell." Awkwardly, I said. "Welcome... I'm glad Fluffy was able to lead you here."

"What do you want?" More coldly, the man demanded.

"My family owns this property, and we are opening it to you, as a place to be warm and safe during this cold season of spring."

The man turned to the others, uncertain, but Kira barked and followed me as I walked past the open gate. At first, they did not follow. Slowly, one by one, they walked through and followed me to the first building. I hit the code to open the door and entered, turning on the light. Inside was a warm and comfortable office setting, with several rooms that had beds, showers, and most importantly... a stockpile of canned goods, drinks, plates, cups, and a microwave.

*What is this place?* Curious, Kira demanded.

Hearing her thoughts, I turned to the leader of the homeless group. "This was a private walled community that failed." Calmly, I explained. "My family intended to convert it into a veterinary hospital complex, only the mayor has thus far refused to rezone it from residential to commercial."

The man gave a teary smile. "I am Joshua Jones." Kindly, he said. "You family honors us with their kindness and generosity."

I returned Joshua's tearful smile. "The honor is mine..."

*Are you certain your father will go for this?* Worried, Kira asked.

Hearing her thoughts, I replied, *Dad purchased this property with my college fund. I had been saving up with odd jobs over the past five years. So, technically, until he pays me back, this property is mine to do with as a please.*

The next day...
11111111222111111221.title: Meeting the homeless.

11112.content:
As myself, whenever someone talked on the phone, I could only hear the person on the other end of the line if the phone was on speaker. Now that I was a dog, though, I could hear both Dad and the vet he was talking to, a man named David.

"There isn't a lot in the file, Chris," David said. "But there are a couple of things that, well, don't normally go into the file."

"Like what?" Dad asked.

"I took a look at her before you examined her. As I wrote, I referred to her as a bitch."

"Yeah?"

"She growled at me."

"That is unusual. What's the other thing?"

"She was dropped off by a couple of researchers from just outside of town. Our receptionist says she overheard them talking as they left. According to her, one of them said, 'Wouldn't it be wild if she changed back while she was in the kennel?'"

"Huh. I'm coming in with a patient, David. I'll be examining him personally, and it's not going in the books. Understand?"

"You're the boss."

When he ended the call, Dad knelt down to my level. "If you understand me, Ken, tilt your head 45 degrees to my right."

I did.

"I want to get to the bottom of this, son. But first, I want to make sure you're alright, and that means I have to be your vet."

"Can we keep him?" asked Kristen, who hadn't stopped petting me since I changed.

"Of course we're keeping him," Mom replied. "He's your brother."

Joel gathered up my clothes to take them with. He got to ride in the front, while Mom sat in the back seat, holding me.
11112.title: A Mysterious Case

111121.content:
I can tell you this much: My dad has a good bedside manner. He made me as comfortable as a teenage boy who has turned into a Cocker Spaniel possibly could be. He told me everything he was doing. I was especially grateful for the heads-up before he used a rectal thermometer on me. I still yelped, of course, but I knew what was going on.

Once he was done with the hands-on portion of the examination, he took me to get X-rays taken. Then, he took me back to the exam room, where the rest of the family waited. Kristen started petting me again. I can't explain it, but being petted relaxed me better than the nature sounds device Mom and Dad had in the master bedroom.

As we waited, something strange happened. First, my sense of smell diminished. It was like my nose was stuffed up, even though I could breathe just fine.

Then, my sense of hearing suddenly dropped. I could hear everyone in the room just fine, but I couldn't hear what was happening outside. On a hunch, I moved my head to indicate my clothes.

Thankfully, Joel was paying attention. "I think he wants his clothes."

"Well, then," Mom said, "let's give them to him, along with some privacy." They left just as my vision became full color again.

Finally, the disorientation effect hit me again. When it lifted, I was a boy again, albeit naked and sitting on an exam table in a vet clinic. I got dressed.

I just finished putting my pants on when there was a knock on the door. "Ken?"

"It's okay."

Dad came in, along with the rest of the family. "Good to see your face again, son," he said.

"Thanks," I replied. "What's the good word?"

"According to the test results, you are - or, rather, were - a perfectly healthy American Cocker Spaniel. Purebred, even."

"What do we do now?" Mom asked.

"Now," Dad replied, "we keep quiet about this until we have more information to work with. I'm as curious about that other dog as anybody, but we can't do anything until we know more."

As we left the vet clinic, I noticed Kristen looking sad. "What's the matter, sis?"

"I wanted a dog."
111121.title: My First Veterinary Examination

1111211.content:
"Put your shoes on, Joel, Kristen," Dad said. "We're going to the pet store."

"Sounds alright," I said, putting on my shoes.

"Not you, Ken," Dad said. "You stay home, until we can figure out what's happening to you."

I returned to my spot on the couch. "You know, Josh says his folks want him to leave the house more often."

"And how many times has Josh turned into a dog?" Mom asked. "We want to protect you, Ken. In the meantime, people are going to wonder what's going on if they see a dog here, but nothing for a dog."

Kristen smiled at me. "If you're a doggy when we get home, you'll get a treat."

"Stay home," Dad said. "And don't let anybody in."

"Stay," I said. "Watch the house. How long before you ask me to roll over?"

Dad shot me a look, but didn't say anything, as he and the rest of the family left to buy all the things a dog needs. It wasn't my fault I started turning into a Cocker Spaniel. Why was I being punished for it?

At least cable was cooperating with me. If I were a character in some cheesy family movie, I'd probably have nothing to watch but Lassie reruns and The Shaggy Dog. But at least I could watch a decent action movie.

I was just getting into the movie when somebody rang the doorbell.

It was Josh Glenn, my best friend, along with Madison King, my girlfriend. "Hey, Ken," she said.

"We didn't see you all day yesterday," Josh said. "Were you sick?"

"Not really." After all, Dad did say I was healthy. Never mind a healthy what.

"Is it okay if we come in?" Madison asked.
1111211.title: The Next Day

11112111.content:
Against my better judgment, I decided to let Josh and Madison come inside. As they walked inside, and I closed the door, I certainly hoped I wouldn’t regret this. I walked into the family room to find them sitting on the couch; Madison showing Josh something on her phone. Looking up at me, she said, “I got some photos from my cruise, you want to see them?”

“Sure.” Spotting a bag of garbage in the kitchen, I said, “First I have to take out the trash. My dad wanted it done before they got home.”

“Sounds good, babe.”

Walking into the kitchen, I grabbed the garbage bag and walked out the backdoor. I went around the side of the house to the trash cans and put the bag inside. As I walked back around, I spotted a squirrel sitting on a nearby rock. Ignoring it, I was about to go up the stairs when I noticed my senses were changing. Oh no.

I barely managed to get out of my clothes, leaving them in a pile on the lawn, before I was once again turned into a dog. I suddenly found myself in the exact situation my folks wanted to prevent by keeping me at home.

I was about to go up the stairs and claw at the door when I spotted the squirrel again. Unlike earlier, when I chose to ignore it, something inside me took over – I started barking and running towards the squirrel. I chased it up a nearby tree, alternating between barking and growling, unable to figure out why I was doing this.

Suddenly I heard voices behind me. I quickly realized they belonged to Josh and Madison. Turning around, I saw them looking at me with confused looks on their faces. “What the hell?” pausing, Josh said, “How’d that dog get in here?”

“I don’t know.” Pointing to my clothes, Madison said, “I’d like to know why Josh’s clothes are on the ground.”

Walking towards me, Josh said, “We should probably get this little guy inside the house before the neighbors start to complain.”
Rather than fight it, I let Josh pick me up and carry me inside, while Madison gathered my clothes up. How am I going to explain this?

Josh put me down in the kitchen while he went to fill a bowl with some water. He was just about to place it on the ground when I heard the front door open. “Ken, we’re home!”

Mom and Dad walked into the kitchen, surprised to find Josh and Madison standing there, but not nearly as surprised as they were to see me looking up at them. Looking at Dad, Josh said, “Somehow this dog got in your backyard. He was barking at something in the tree.”

“I was wondering when this might come up.” Sighing, placing a bag on the table, Dad said, “Josh. Madison. This is going to sound very strange, but that dog is Ken.”
11112111.title: I Invite Them In

111121111.content:
"That dog is Ken?" Josh reacted the way just about anybody would have. "Don't kid a kidder, Doc. People... people don't turn into dogs. They... they don't."

"Watch him," Dad said. Then, facing me, he said, "Kenneth James Maxwell."

Dad held people who hit their pets in the same low regard as people who hit their kids. When we did wrong, he demonstrated that he didn't even need to yell: his tone of voice conveyed everything. And I can tell you, from personal experience, hearing him state your full name in that tone let you know you'd disappointed him.

"Whoa," Madison said. "That dog actually flinched, just like Ken does when you... " I could smell how scared she was. She knelt down and looked at me. "Ken? Ken, is... is that... you?"

I nodded.

Madison reacted, I think, the way a lot of people would have: she passed out.

I did the only thing I could think to do: I licked her face.

Josh looked at the scene before him in disbelief. "How... how did this happen?"

"We don't know the answers," Dad said. "Two days ago, he was bitten by a Cocker Spaniel, and, since then,... " He gestured to indicate me.

"What can we do?"

"About all we can do is try to keep this a secret for as long as possible. But we can't keep the existence of a dog secret, so we'll tell people we're pet-sitting for relatives."

"Relatives who just happened to name their dog the same thing as your son?"

"Charlie is the most common name for a male Cocker Spaniel," Dad said. "So, when he's like this, his name is Charlie."

Madison came to, finally, and she looked at me. "Oh, Ken,... " she said, and hugged me. Normally, I loved being hugged, but now, in this body, it felt... unnatural.
111121111.title: The Truth Is Out

1111211111.content:
My family showed me the things they'd bought at the pet store: top-of-the-line dog food (I wondered how long it would be before I found out how it tasted), stainless steel bowls ( "more hygienic than plastic," Dad said, "and it'll keep water cooler longer"), various treats (they smelled good, but Mom wouldn't give me one, because I'd been naughty), and a leash and collar. "Joel," Dad said, "why don't you take him for a walk around the block? Let people know that he's here with us."

Mom adjusted my collar, and Joel attached the leash to it. Satisfied, Dad opened the door and let us out.

We hadn't gone far down the street when we came across Mr. Damon, our next door neighbor, walking his pride and joy, Queenie. Queenie was his Poodle, and he doted on her. In his spare time, he bred her. She had just whelped last year, so she was to take a year off.

While Mr. Damon told all this to Joel, Queenie was teaching me about the treasure troves of information that are a dog's anal glands. I couldn't explain how or why, but I understood what her butt secretions were telling me about her: that she was healthy, well-fed,... and she would be fertile soon. This last was most important to me, for some reason.

Halfway around the block, I realized that I had to go to the bathroom... and soon. I actually looked around for a restroom before I remembered that, even if there had been one nearby, I couldn't have used it as a dog. Ashamed of myself, I lifted my leg and relieved myself against a tree. Then, I got into a squatting position and relieved myself the other way. Disgusted, Joel took out a bag and collected my deposit.
1111211111.title: I Go for a Walk

11112111111.content:
"Don't bring that into the house," Mom told Joel. "Throw it away in the trash can."

As Joel left, I saw that Madison and Josh were still here. "You okay in there, buddy?" Josh asked, handing me a brand new chew toy.

I took the toy and began chewing on it, in the middle of the room. "He acts so much like a dog," Madison said. "He was barking and chasing a squirrel, and now the way he's playing with that toy."

"The structure of a dog's mouth makes speech difficult, if not impossible," Dad explained. "As for Ken's behavior, I'd say that he's reacting to canine instincts. But he seems to have his full human intelligence, and he remembers everything that happens in one form or the other. I can assure you, the Ken we all know and love is inside this dog."

As Dad spoke, I noticed my senses were changing again. I picked up my chew toy and went behind the couch.

"Do you think we embarrassed him," Josh asked, "talking about him right in front of him?"

"Possibly," Dad replied. "Or he may have withdrawn for another reason." By the time Dad finished speaking, I was myself again.

"Like what?"

In answer, I raised my hand. "Little help?"

"He needs his clothes," Josh guessed, and did the honors.

Once I was dressed, I came out and joined the group, sitting next to Madison. "You okay, Ken?" she asked.

"As okay as a guy can be," I replied, "when he keeps turning into a dog. How about you?"

"I guess I could get used to it," she said. A slight smile played across her face. "Maybe, next time, I'll try petting you."

"No need to wait for that," I said, and began kissing her.

"I don't know which is grosser," Joel said, "watching him poop, or watching him kiss."
11112111111.title: Changing Back

111121111111.content:
Madison and Josh came over again the next day. "Can I ask you something, Ken?" Madison asked.

"Anything," I replied.

"What's it like? Becoming a dog, I mean."

We were boyfriend and girlfriend, so I didn't think she meant anything else. "Well, my senses change before the rest of me does, so that's how I know it's happening. It's the same with changing back. As for being a dog, my favorite part, so far, is Kristen petting me."

"That's her favorite part, too," Mom said.

"My least favorite part, so far, is definitely doing my business outside, where anybody can see."

"It's no picnic to have to watch, either," Joel said.

Ignoring Joel, I continued, "Before that, I would have said my least favorite thing was not being able to talk. Barks, growls, and whines don't communicate everything I want to, and most dog communication is silent. If you'll excuse me, it's time to let Charlie out." I went to the downstairs guest bedroom, where I had just enough time to get out of my clothes before I changed.

A dog again, I walked back to the living room, jumped up on the couch, and curled up in Madison's lap.

She immediately began petting me. "This does feel good," she said. "I can only guess how it feels for you."

She began to scratch me just above the base of my tail. When she did, I sat up, closed my eyes, and leaned my head back.

"I think you've made a friend for life," Josh said.
111121111111.title: The Next Time

1111211111111.content:
It was almost 5:00 in the afternoon and I had yet to change back to human form again. I began to suspect that I was going to be like this for the rest of the evening. Kristen and Joel were watching TV in the den; while Mom cooked dinner and Dad was in his office.

Mom had just let me back inside after I’d gone out to relieve myself. Grabbing a Kong bone that Madison had brought over this morning, I walked into the den and plopped down on the floor. I could hear Kristen and Joel chuckling as they watched me chewing on the bone.

I couldn’t explain it, but something about chewing the bone was relaxing to me. I lay on the carpet, chewing the bone, for a few minutes until Joel came over and pulled it away from me. I growled briefly as I looked up at him. “Relax bro, there’s no need to growl.”

I watched as Joel then proceeded to throw the bone down the hall. Something clicked inside me; as I got up and ran down the hall to retrieve the bone. So that’s what he wants, huh? Running back down the hall, I dropped the bone at Joel’s feet and watched as he threw the bone down the hall again. We repeated this for a few minutes until Mom walked into the den from the kitchen. Looking at me, she said, “Ken, honey, it’s time for dinner.”

I’d smelled something interesting coming from the kitchen for the last few minutes. As I followed Mom into the kitchen, I figured it was the pasta she was cooking for dinner. I found out I was mistaken when the scent led me to the dog bowl – which was full of a mix of wet and dry dog food.

The few times I’d looked after Queenie, I found the smell of dog food to be somewhat nauseating. But this time was different; it smelled downright delicious. Before I realized what I was doing, I leaned over the bowl and started eating.
1111211111111.title: What's Next for Charlie?

11112111111111.content:
After supper, Mom and Dad said that I should go for another walk, since I was still a dog. I was in complete agreement, but Joel said he should get something first.

That something turned out to be his backpack, which he filled with my clothes. I knew it was a good idea, but I needed to go for a walk, and I needed to go now.

Sure enough, though, as soon as I finished pooping, my sense of smell dropped back down to human levels. As Joel bagged my deposit, I whined and put my paws on his backpack.

"Now?" Joel asked. "Okay, we're close to the backyard. Try to hold it for that long, okay?"

That turned out to be longer than he anticipated, because he forgot that the back gate was latched, and he had to unlatch it from the outside. When he finally did it, he turned around and saw a very naked older brother behind him.

Once I was dressed, we went back into the house. Dad said, "Your changes seem to be completely random. For that reason, I don't want you leaving the house alone until we get a handle on this."

"How about if Josh or Madison is with me?"

He thought about that for a minute, then said, "We'll see."
11112111111111.title: Continue

choices: I Make It Home as Charlie
111121111111112.content:
When I woke up the next morning, I realized that I had changed into Charlie at some point, and I was still a Cocker Spaniel. I wriggled out of my pajamas and crawled out from under the sheet.

Mom called up the stairs, "Kids, come on down, it's time for breakfast."

In response, I barked twice.

"Joel," Mom said, "open Ken's door, so Charlie can come out."

Joel did, and I headed downstairs, where Mom was dishing out a bowl of dog food and a bowl of water for me. Maybe it was me, but the dog food tasted better than the sugary cereals that had been the cornerstone of my breakfast as Ken. As I ate, she went upstairs.

Joel and Kristen came down, and Joel helped Kristen get her breakfast while she petted me.

When Mom came back down, she had a duffel bag with my clothes in it. "This morning," she said to me, "we're going to see how far we can go before you change back."

Once I finished my bowl, Mom put the leash and collar on me, then she took me on a walk through the neighborhood for the first time as Charlie.
111121111111112.title: I Wake Up as Charlie

1111211111111122.content:
Joel only took me around the block when he walked me, but Mom took me through the whole neighborhood. I guess she really wanted me to get my exercise, even if it risked me changing out in the open. As we walked, people complimented me on how well-behaved I was, and they all petted me. I honestly can't say which I liked better.

After a while, I saw another Cocker Spaniel out for a walk. Funny thing, though: this one didn't have anyone with it, and its fur was all tangled and matted. "Look at that poor girl," Mom said. "She must have been wandering around for days."

That's when I realized: That "poor girl" was the dog that bit me, and cursed me to change into a dog myself! I started barking at her.

"What's gotten into you all of a sudden?" Mom asked me.

I kept barking, and staring at that other dog.

Finally, Mom put two and two together, and picked up her phone. "Chris, it's Andie. I think we've found the dog." She told Dad where we were.

Dad drove to us in no time. The dog saw him, and tried to run, but Mom let me off the leash, and I chased her down. It didn't help her that she probably hadn't eaten much since she ran from the vet clinic.

Funny thing: As I chased her, I kept hearing a woman's voice, saying "No!"

Dad caught up with us, and he wrapped her up in his jacket and carried her. "Easy, girl," he said to her. "Let's get you cleaned up, and get you some food. Then, maybe, we can get some answers."

Mom and I were over by the park when it came time for me to change back. Luckily, nobody was in the men's restroom, so I could become myself and get dressed without anyone seeing me.
1111211111111122.title: I See the Dog that Bit Me

choices: I Won't Let Them Examine Me
11112111111111221.content:
It was almost lunchtime when the phone rang. I answered it. "Hello?"

"Ken!" Dad said. "Good to hear your voice again. How are you?"

"Waiting to hear what's up," I replied. "So, what's up?"

"Well, that was no ordinary dog that bit you."

"Really? You don't say! What was your first clue? Mine was, I keep turning into a freaking Cocker Spaniel!"

"What I mean is, that dog was once human, too."

Okay, I didn't expect to hear that. I sat down. "What? How?"

"Apparently, somebody wanted to find a way to improve communication between people and their dogs. Somebody got overzealous and administered an untested formula to an intern. The next thing anybody knows, she's a dog. They took her to me, to see how complete her transformation was, and, well, you know the rest."

"Okay," I said. "So, why am I changing?"

"They think that her saliva might have contained a diluted version of the formula. Are you sitting down, Ken?"

"Yes."

"They would like for you to go in and let them check you out. They think that, maybe, you can help them find a way to reverse the effects of the formula."

"They... they want to study me?"

"No, Ken, they want to examine you. This may be our chance to fix this." He paused. "I can't make this decision for you, Ken. It's up to you."
11112111111111221.title: Answers

111121111111112211.content:
Despite my intense reservations, I consented to having myself examined by the scientists. Dad and I drove to the lab with the (for lack of a better word) dog, while Mom stayed home with Joel and Kristen.

The lab was about 20 minutes outside of town, and I was looking out the window in an attempt to keep my mind off of everything that’s been happening. I was watching a flock of birds fly overhead when I heard whimpering from the back seat. Turning around, I saw the other dog lying inside the cage Dad had put her in, a sad look in her eyes.

It didn’t take a genius to figure out what had the dog so upset. Turning to Dad, I said, “Do we have to keep her in a cage? It doesn’t seem fair, especially if she used to be human.”

“I’m not taking any chances with her; besides, the scientists suggested that I do it.”

“What can you tell me about her?” glancing back at the dog, I said. “What’s her name?”

“Her name is Samantha Wilson; she is... rather, was a graduate student working at Higglo Pharmaceutical.” Coming to a stop light,
Dad said, “Like I said at home, someone got overzealous and injected her with a new formula; which, as you can see, turned her into a dog.”

“It’s been a few days since she bit me. So why does it look like she hasn’t changed back into a human?”

“That’s why the scientists wanted me to bring her along, to see why she hasn’t changed back.” Turning to look at Samantha, Dad said, “Don’t worry, Ms. Wilson, I’m sure everything is going to be fine.”

I looked back at Samantha as she put her head down and started whimpering again.
111121111111112211.title: I Consent

1111211111111122111.content:
The examination began fairly normally, with the doctor asking me to change into a hospital gown. After that, they checked my vitals and drew a blood sample. It was only when they asked for samples of my urine and feces that it didn't seem normal anymore. Luckily for them, I was able to give them what they needed.

After that, the doctor started asking me questions. "When were you bitten?"

"Friday morning."

"And when did you first change?"

"That night."

"Have you ever become a different breed of dog, or is it always an American Cocker Spaniel?"

"It's always the Cocker Spaniel."

"Does anything trigger the changes?"

"No, it seems to happen at any time of day, under any circumstances."

"Does anything signal that a change is coming?"

"Yeah, my senses become more like a dog's before I become Charlie, and more like a human's before I change back."

"Charlie?"

"It's the name we use when he changes," Dad explained, "to explain the presence of a dog in the house. What do we do now?"

"Now?" the doctor said. "Now, we wait until Charlie wants to come out."
