Right about then, I started smelling the doctor's aftershave, and the lingering scent of his lunch on his breath. "Then I've got good news for you."

A minute later, I was a dog for the second time that day.

Then the doctor began examining me again, but with a much worse bedside manner than Dad had. He didn't care how I felt about the things he was doing to me.

"I'm sorry," Dad said whenever the doctor did something differently than he would have. And he had plenty of occasions to say it.

Once he was done with that, he took me for a short walk, so he could collect my urine and feces as a dog.

When he was done, he brought me to a kennel, and locked me in. Samantha was in the kennel next to me. "When you change back," the doctor said, "let us know."

As the doctor left, I heard a woman's voice in my head: *Change back? Good God, what have I done?*

*Samantha? Is that you?*
1111211111111122111.title: The Examination

11112111111111221111.content:
The dog next to me perked up when I said that. *You must hate me for what I did to you?*

*I’d be lying if I said I was okay with randomly turning into a dog.*

I guess the cages were meant to be moved around, because I saw handles on each side. Looking through one of them, I saw
Samantha looking at me. *At least you get to change back. I’ve been stuck like this for almost a week.*

I started to feel sorry for her when I heard that, wondering if she was stuck this way. *Are you stuck like this or something?*

*That’s what my boss seemed to think, before he brought me to your dad’s clinic. I suppose I should apologize for biting you. I got scared when I heard you mention the possibility of being spayed.*

*That’s okay, I probably would have reacted the same way.*

*I can’t help but notice you haven’t asked me the most important question.*

I’d been trying to figure out how to ask that particular question; because, until this started, I never thought it was possible. *What were you working on here? I didn’t think it was possible for a human to turn into a dog.*

*Neither did I, until I woke up looking like this. We were working on a way to help humans communicate with dogs; this was just an unexpected side effect.*

*What are you going to do now? I mean, what if you’re stuck as a dog permanently?*

*I’ll have to cross that bridge when we come to it. There are only 4 people, including you and your father, who know I used to be human. As far as everyone else is concerned, I’m just your garden variety 1-year-old cocker spaniel.*

*One year old?*

*Whatever did this to me was very thorough; I couldn’t very well be a 24-year-old dog. The lead scientist told me I’m just over one year old, and, apparently, a month or so away from going into heat.*

*If it makes you feel any better, I can see about convincing my folks to adopt you. Give you a home and a family to look out for you.*

*I can’t say I expected that; especially after what I did to you. Thank you,... Ken.*

*My folks call me Charlie when I’m in dog form.*

*Well then, it’s nice to meet you, Charlie.*

It wasn’t long before a worker entered the kennel area. He took one look at Samantha and me and grumbled to himself. “I would have appreciated a heads up about there being animals in here.” Walking up to our cages, he looked at us and said, “I suppose you stupid animals want to be fed.”

As I stared at the man, I heard Samantha’s voice in my head. *Do you think it’d be alright if I bit him?*
11112111111111221111.title: Samantha and I "Converse"

111121111111112211111.content:
The worker gave us dog food. Samantha sniffed it and whined. *The brightest minds in town, and none of them can read the ingredients list.*

It was certainly nothing Instagram-worthy. *My dad's a vet, and he gets me top-of-the-line dog food. This ain't it.*

*Okay, now you're just rubbing it in.*

*You think that's rubbing it in? I've got a change coming on.*

*I guess that's one way to get out of eating this stuff.*

A moment later, I was Ken again, cooped up in a kennel, and stark naked. "Little help in here?"

The worker came in response to my shout, followed by the doctor. The worker fainted at the sight of me.

"Let's get you a gown," the doctor said, "and take a look at our findings."

Once I was in a gown, the doctor led me back to the exam room. As I left the kennels, Samantha said, *You look much cuter furry.*

******************************


"The results are in," the doctor said. "That's the good news."

"What's the bad news?" Dad asked.

"They're inconclusive. It's as if his body is trying to decide if it should be human or dog. He might regain full humanity. He might become a dog permanently. Or he might change back and forth for the rest of his life. We have no way of knowing."

After I got dressed, but before we left, I asked, "What are you guys going to do with Samantha?"

Long story short, she came home with us.
111121111111112211111.title: My Results

1111211111111122111111.content:
"You guys got a dog?" Josh asked. "Besides the one you turn into?"

"Samantha needed a home," I explained, "and people to love her and take care of her."

"Samantha?" Madison asked. "You mean you got a girl?"

"Yes, we did. In fact, she's the one who bit me. She was an intern, working on a way to improve communication between pets and their people. Somebody decided to try it out on her, and she turned into a Cocker Spaniel. You know the rest."

"Does she change back and forth, like you?" asked Madison.

"No, she seems to be stuck as a dog. Speaking of me changing, a little privacy?"

Madison and Josh left the room, and Charlie came out to play.

Josh just got done gathering up my clothes, when the rest of the family came home, Samantha included. "Oh, look, Samantha," Mom said, "Charlie's here to welcome you home."

"Ken told us about Samantha," Madison said, "or, at least, most of it. How's she doing?"

"She's physically healthy," Dad replied. "And, now that she's had her shots, she'll stay that way for quite some time. And she's got a chip, just in case she gets lost. As for how her mind is doing, we don't know yet. But I've got something coming, that should help us all."

Samantha turned to me. *You haven't told your parents about how you and I can communicate?*

*No, I haven't. I was scared that, if it got out, we might end up back at the lab. You know what they do to people. Do you want to find out what they think is a good way to treat dogs?*

*Good point. What was your father talking about?*

*No idea. He wouldn't let me into his office, even as Ken.*
1111211111111122111111.title: Two Dogs at Home

11112111111111221111111.content:
A few hours later, Mom was going through the mail, when she found something of interest. "Chris, you've got something from a medical supply company."

"Go ahead and open it," he said. "I'll be right there."

Mom opened it. It was a board with letters of the alphabet on it. "What in the world... ?"

"That's a communication board," Dad said. "They use them to converse with patients who are nonverbal. I figured, if it works for stroke patients,... "

"... it should work for people who have become dogs," Mom said, finishing Dad's sentence. "Charlie, Samantha, come take a look at this." Mom put it on the floor.

Dad came into the room. "Who wants to try it out?"

Samantha walked up to the board, sniffed it, then touched the letters with her nose. Mom read along: "T-H-A- THANK YOU D-R- DR. AND MRS. MAXWELL."

Dad knelt down and petted Samantha. "You're very welcome, Samantha. How about you, Ken?"

I touched the letters as Dad followed along. "I L-O-V- LOVE Y-O- YOU ALL."

Dad laughed. "That's good to hear, Ken. And, as you use the board, I'll learn enough to design your very own board."
11112111111111221111111.title: Dad's Idea

111121111111112211111111.content:
A few days had passed since Charlie’s last appearance; I’d taken advantage of the time to catch up on TV shows and hanging out with my friends. It was a rainy Saturday morning and I was in my room playing video games; while Joel and Kristen were off with their friends. We still didn’t want to risk me changing in public, so I was pretty much limited to the house at all times.

I had just gotten killed by another player when I heard the garage door close – my parents must’ve returned with Bella; that was the name Samantha had chosen for herself as a dog. I have to admit I enjoyed having her around; we played in the backyard regardless of what species I was, she slept on my bed and generally spent most of her time with me.

We got to know each other as well. It turns out she didn’t have the best childhood growing up; her parents had died when she was a kid and she was placed in the foster system. She didn’t let that get her down however, as she worked her way through college until she got the internship.

I had just paused the game when I heard footsteps coming up the stairs; followed shortly after by Bella running into my room and jumping on the bed. As she licked me excitedly, Bella said, *How do I look, Ken?*

*What do you mean?*

Backing away, Bella sat down on the bed and looked at me. *Your parents took me to the groomers.* her tail wagging, Bella said, *I feel really pretty.*

I chuckled at that. *You’re a dog, Bella; how can you feel pretty?*

*I still think like a woman, Ken.* growling a little, Bella said, *Unless you want me to bite you again, you better tell me I’m pretty.*

*Okay, Bella, you’re very pretty.* suddenly getting a familiar feeling, I said, *I’ll be right back, I think Charlie wants to say you’re pretty too.*
111121111111112211111111.title: Days Later

choices: Joel Gets a Good Laugh at My Expense
1111211111111122111111111.content:
Dad sighed when he saw me come downstairs with Bella. "I was starting to hope it was out of your system," he said.

Kristen was glad to see me as Charlie, though. "Are you gonna take Charlie to the groomer, too?" she asked. "I think he'd like to look pretty, too."

To my surprise, I didn't know how I felt about the prospect of having a total stranger fuss over my appearance. I knew I liked it when Mom brushed me, but would it be the same?

At any rate, Dad said, "No, I don't want to risk him changing back at the groomer's. Joel, why don't you take Bella and Charlie to the dog park? I'm sure they'd like to have a chance to play. You'll find Ken's clothes upstairs."

And so it was that the three of us went to the dog park. I have to admit, I was enjoying playing fetch. Bella liked it, too.

Then I smelled something that made me forget all about fetching a stick.

I walked around, sniffing the air, until I found the source of this new smell: a Golden Retriever.

A Golden Retriever bitch.

I walked right up to her, investigating her alluring scent. Her people, two men, seemed more amused by my interest than anything else. "She's a bit out of your league, little fella," one man said.

Joel came and pulled me away. "Come on, Charlie," he said, "you're bothering them."

"I don't think he can help himself," the other man said. "We knew she'd be in heat soon. I guess today's the day."

In heat.

That was the smell I was reacting to. Can this get any worse? I asked myself.

Apparently, it could: When I changed back to Ken a few moments later, I still had an erection.
1111211111111122111111111.title: Later On (The Dog Park)

11112111111111221111111111.content:
Joel couldn't resist telling everyone at home what I almost did at the dog park. "You should have seen him! He really wanted it!"

Dad didn't give Joel the response he wanted. "Charlie acts like a perfectly normal dog in all other respects," he said. "His reaction to the scent of a dog in estrus is not surprising."

But Bella, on the other hand, started giving me the cold shoulder. I couldn't understand it. You'd think, out of everyone on the planet, she would understand what I was going through. But everything I said to her fell on deaf ears.

Madison seemed to think it was funny, too. "I've heard girls call the other woman a dog before," she said, "but, apparently, my rival has papers and everything."

The worst of it came a few days later. Mom, Joel, and Kristen came back from grocery shopping. "Here, Ken," Joel said, tossing me something. "I found you some porn!"

I picked it up. It was an issue of Dog Fancy.

I growled at Joel. For the first time in my life, I wanted to bite someone.
11112111111111221111111111.title: Joel Gets a Good Laugh at My Expense

111121111111112211111111111.content:
About a week after the incident at the dog park, the neighbor called. "I have to go out of town for a few days," he said. "Can you kids look after Queenie for me? There's money in it for you."

The money only sweetened the deal, as there wasn't one of us who didn't love Queenie. We made a schedule for who would do what for Queenie when, and he left us the keys.

The first evening of the watch, it was my turn to feed Queenie, so I went next door to do that. She was glad to see me as I came in, even though our schedule made sure that she was never left alone for too long. I put fresh food in her bowl (I was glad to see that she ate the same brand of dog food that Bella and, occasionally, I ate), then we played fetch.

Unfortunately, while we were playing, I felt a change coming on. I got up to leave, but, before I got to the door, Queenie had a new friend to play with: Charlie.

What's more, one sniff told me something that Queenie's master had left out: Queenie was in heat.

And she was a hell of a lot more receptive to my charms than that Golden Retriever had been. Moments after sniffing me, she presented to me. I couldn't resist, and we mated.

Interesting thing about two dogs mating: the male gets his privates locked into the female's nether regions for several minutes after the act is complete. I don't blame you for not knowing this; I didn't know it myself, until it happened to me.

And so it was while I was in that position that Madison came over. "Hey, Ken," she called out, "did you forget we had a date? I hope you and Queenie aren't having too much fun... oh."

It was while she was taking in the image of me and Queenie locked together, that I changed back, which at least extricated me from Queenie.

"I cannot deal with this," Madison said as she left.

And so I got dressed and went home, instead of on the date with Madison.
111121111111112211111111111.title: Queenie

1111211111111122111111111111.content:
The next morning, I got to the breakfast table after everyone else, so I licked their faces and poured some cereal into a bowl.

"What brought that on?" Joel asked.

"What brought what on?" I countered.

"Ken,... " Dad said, "you... you licked us. You licked our faces."

I paused. Now that Dad had said it out loud, it did sound like I had done something strange. But it seemed perfectly normal, natural even, at the time.

Whatever. What was done was done. I poured on the milk and began to eat.

"Ken!"

I stopped eating when Mom yelled. And then I realized why she did: I was eating my cereal by sticking my face in the bowl.

"What has gotten into you?"

"I... I don't know," I replied. "It... it just seemed so... natural."

Bella barked.

Dad followed her to the communication board, where she began to spell: "I DID THE S-A-SAME THINGS R-I-RIGHT B-E-BEFORE I B-E-BECAME A DOG," Dad read. Turning to Bella, he asked, "And you think that's what's happening to Ken?"

She touched a square. "YES."

I was becoming a dog. And, this time, it looked like it would be permanent.
1111211111111122111111111111.title: Behavioral Problems

11112111111111221111111111111.content:
My first thought, after I panicked over losing my humanity forever, was to call Madison.

My first call went straight to voicemail. What I had to say was too important for voicemail, though, so I just said, "Madison, it's Ken. Please, I need to talk to you. It's urgent." And it was, too: I had no idea how human I would be tomorrow.

I tried calling her a few more times, but all I got was her voicemail. I began to realize that she was ignoring my calls.

Under normal circumstances, I would have waited until she wanted to talk to me. But I had no idea how long that would take, or how human and how canine I would be. So I went straight to her house.

Her parents' car wasn't in the driveway. I hoped that meant that we would be alone. I began by throwing pebbles, one at a time, at her window.

She came to the window, but, when she saw me, she closed her curtains again.

Undaunted, I began throwing several pebbles at a time, to let her know that I wasn't going anywhere until I talked to her.

Finally, she opened the back door. "What?"

"Madison," I began, "first, I want to apologize for last night. Once Charlie smelled Queenie, he stopped thinking with my head."

"Typical guy," she said, and started to close the door.

I stopped it with one hand. "I know you want some time to deal with this, but I don't have much of that to give you."

"What do you mean?"

"Madison,... " And, suddenly, it seemed like the hardest possible thing to say. "Madison, I... I've started acting like a dog, even when I'm Ken. And Bella says it... it won't be long before I'm not me anymore, I'll be Charlie, permanently."

She stood there for a while, saying nothing. But she had stopped trying to shut the door, so that was something. Finally, she stepped aside, and motioned for me to come in.

Once we were inside, she sat on the couch, and I tried to curl up in her lap. She had to push me off to one side. "You really are acting like a dog."

I nodded.

"And... and you think you're going to be Charlie for the rest of your life?"

I nodded again.

She wrapped me in her arms and kissed me.
11112111111111221111111111111.title: I Call Madison

111121111111112211111111111111.content:
"What's going on at home?" Madison asked.

"Kristen doesn't understand," I replied, "so she keeps asking what I did. Joel thinks it's a hoot. And Bella's quit talking to me. Dad says he understands. But, with this,... I'm sure they're scared, but not half as much as I am. I... I need you, Madison." I wanted to kiss her, but, instead, I licked her face.

She didn't complain. Instead, when she pulled away, it was to say, "Ken,... maybe we should finish this upstairs."

I nodded, and she led me up to her room, closing the door behind us. Before I could lick her again, she kissed me, the reminder of how humans did things reminding me that I was still human.

She began to undress me, so I began to undress her. We broke physical contact so we could take off our tops, then we were back at it.

When she got on the bed and looked up at me, I paused, unsure of what I should do next. She seemed to understand, nodded, and then rolled over, getting up on her hands and knees. Now I understood.

And that was our first time together.

About half an hour later, we were both ready again. This time, she lay on her back, and talked me through what I had to do.

We fell asleep in each other's arms.

That was our last time together.
111121111111112211111111111111.title: Lovemaking

1111211111111122111111111111111.content:
I must’ve changed while we were sleeping because I woke up to Madison playfully scratching my belly. That was three days ago and I hadn’t returned to human form yet. I know I should’ve been worried; instead, I was actually kind of enjoying it.

I was out in the backyard playing with fetch with Kristen and Bella; who I’m happy to say, is no longer ignoring me. Kristen had just thrown the rubber bone towards the back fence, and I was about to go after it when the sound of a closing car door got my attention.

Bella and I ran to the gate and started barking; overjoyed that our masters...I mean, my parents and Joel were home. Joel came in through the gate and was immediately pounced on by myself and Bella; the two of us licking him excitedly. After three days as a dog, it was getting easier for my dog-side to take over; I tried to fight it at first but realized it was going to win eventually.

Bella had just finished slobbering on Joel’s face, and it was my turn; only he pushed me away before I even had a chance. I let out a low growl, to which he said, “There’s no way I’m letting you lick me, Charlie; not after what I saw you doing this morning.”

*****Flashback*****


Mom had been gardening this morning, and she had an open bag of mulch behind her. I don’t know why, but the smell of the mulch was quite appealing and I ended up eating a small amount of it; that was until Mom put a stop to it.

The mulch must’ve upset my stomach; because I was soon vomiting on the patio. Now I knew that dogs had been known to eat their vomit, I just never realized how strong the compulsion to do so could be. I tried to resist but eventually started licking my vomit off the patio; just as Joel walked out from the kitchen.

“Charlie, no!” Joel quickly shooed me away while he got a hose to wash the rest of the vomit away.

**********


Feeling spurned by my master...brother, I slowly walked back to retrieve the bone. Before I even got passed the swing set, I felt a familiar sensation. It wasn’t long before I was human again; which I couldn’t help but feel sad about.
1111211111111122111111111111111.title: The Changes Begin

1111211111111122111111111112.content:
Things took a turn for the worse after Madison had caught me mating with Queenie. By the time I’d gotten dressed and returned to the house, she’d told everyone what she had seen Queenie and me doing. Before I could stop her to explain what happened, she grabbed her purse and ran out of the house without saying a word.

I walked back into the family room to find everyone staring at me. Joel was chuckling, Mom was staring at me in shock, and Kristen was confused, Dad was the only one who appeared to be sympathetic to what happened.

Joel walked past me on the way to the stairs, saying, “I can’t believe you lost your virginity to a dog.”

I glared at him while he walked upstairs. I was embarrassed enough already,... or so I thought. That changed when Kristen looked at Mom and said, “What was Charlie doing to Queenie, Mommy?”

Mom glared at me for a moment, as to if to punish me for having to explain canine mating to my sister. Turning to Kristen, Mom said, “It’s just like when two people love each other very much, sweetie. Charlie and Queenie were just... professing their feelings for each other.”

Not exactly Mom; I think Charlie was the only one doing the professing here. Mom and Kristen walked out of the room, while Dad sat down on the couch. Looking at me, he said, “Do you want to talk about it, Ken?”

“Not particularly, Dad.” Sighing, I said, “I’d much prefer to forget about it. Right now, I just hope I didn’t ruin things with Madison.”

“I’m certain she’ll come around eventually.” Placing a hand on my shoulder, Dad said, “If the roles were reversed, I’d like to think you’d forgive her.”

“Thanks Dad.” Getting up, I said, “I-I think I’m going to go up to my room for a while.”

“I’ll be in the office if you want to talk.”

As I walked upstairs to my room, I saw Bella walking out of my bedroom. Before I could even say anything to her, she took one
look at me and started growling at me. Looking at her, I said, “What’s gotten up your butt?"

*Not you,* pausing, Bella said, *I can forgive you for the dog at the park. But why the stuck up poodle from next door?*

It took me a few seconds to realize what she was getting at. Looking at her, I said, *Wait, are you angry that I didn’t mate with you?*

Bella didn’t say a word; she just looked at me and walked down the hall to Kristen’s room. I just stood there in the hallway, as I tried to process everything that just happened.
1111211111111122111111111112.title: The Aftermath
